medical_history.chief_complaint: Estrogen deficiency due to a novel mutation in the CYP19 gene causing open epiphyses.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 27-year-old male, presented with clinical signs of congenital aromatase deficiency. His physical examination showed eunuchoid proportions, bilateral genu valgum, kyphoscoliosis, and abdominal striae. He exhibited normal secondary male characteristics with a height of 197 cm and weight of 120 kg. Bone age was assessed at 16.5 years, indicating delayed skeletal maturation with open epiphyses, which began to close after 3 months of estrogen replacement therapy.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents are heterozygous for the same mutation, and the patient is the only child of consanguineous parents.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is single, lives with his parents, and works as a civil servant. He has no offspring.
